metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14386 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before 5.9-rc4. Memory corruption can be exploited to gain root privileges from unprivileged processes. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity. Or Cohen discovered that the AF_PACKET implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

notes.Note: sbeattie> requires CAP_NET_RAW cascardo> Added break as investigated by Solar Designer. sbeattie> older backports without 8e8e2951e309 will need second lore.kernel.org variant

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
